description.narrative: Increase access to finance The Project will enhance BHD''s capital structure maintaining its ability to continue growing and supporting the SME segment which will increase access to finance in a market with low banking penetration. Greater access to finance is expected to stimulate the growth of businesses and, in turn, employment generation. Resource Mobilization The capacity to mobilize other investors through the AMC to provide a significant amount of funding at a time of global instability.

The proposed project entails financing of approximately US$25 million to Banco BHD (BHD or The Bank), a longstanding client and partner of the IFC, in Subordinated Debt through the IFC Capitalization Fund. The loan, structured to qualify as Tier II capital under Dominican regulations, is aimed to support the growth of BHDs loan portfolio which contains an important component of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) and a new portfolio of EE projects. The project is consistent with IFC''s Strategy in the Dominican Republic by emphasizing and strengthening linkages with existing clients in order to support their sustainability and expansion.
